column4: you might try purging (completely removing) the package, and then reinstalling it
purging will completely remove your entire configuration, thou8gh
how do I do this already did apt-get remove and apt-get install
apt-get remove --purge packagename will competely remove the package and configuration
already done that no change
is not recreating the directories that where deleted
if the directories are indeed part of that package, it will recreate them
it created empty directories and when trying to start it just states failed
what package are you trying to fix?
dhcp3-server
what files are missing?
the complete directory structure
under /etc/dhcp3 and etc/init.d/dhcp3-server
can I have the name of one of the missing files?
ok
according to http://packages.ubuntu.com/intrepid/i386/dhcp3-server/filelist, the dhcp3-server package should give you those files
stupid me I installed on my other linux and copied the missing files
how can I ping a destination to see what the ip of that mac is?
you have to know the IP of the other computer, and then you can do ping 10.0.99.99
(where 10.0.99.99 is the ip of the other computer)
well I know the gateway but need to figure out the mac of that gateway
oh, sorry. If you can (or have) nmap installed, then just do nmap ip_address
